name: comalign
title: ComAlign
description: <text lang="en">is a program, that given a number of sequences generates a number of heuristic alignments and combines these best possible.</text> </description>

seq.comment: <text lang="en">the sequences must be in the GenAl format</text> </comment>

format.python: ( "" , " -s" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

seqnb.prompt: Number of sequences that are to be aligned (-n)

format.python: ( "" , " -n" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -i" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

iterations.comment: <text lang="en">On each iteration a new alignment is added to the pool of alignments ComAlign is working on</text> </comment>

score.prompt: Score: ComAlign records the time it took to find a solution as good as this score (-l)

time.prompt: ComAlign marks the best solution found after this number of 1/100 seconds (-t)

last_iterations.prompt: Makes ComAlign terminate if the score hasn't changed within the last this number of iterations (-c)

format.python: ( "" , " -c" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

print_best.prompt: Print the best found alignment on termination (-a)

comment: <text lang="en"> Use this interface to add new sequences to an existing alignment.</text> <text lang="en">The profile is converted into a HMM and the un-aligned sequences will be multiply aligned (using the HMM background information) to form a profile; this constructed profile is aligned with the input profile; the columns in each profile (the original one and the one created from the un-aligned sequences) will be kept fixed and the alignment of the two profiles will be written out. The un/aligned sequences must contain at least two sequences.</text> </comment>
